title: U.S. Envoys Meet Russian Leader to Talk About Ukraine War
summary: Two American officials, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow to discuss ending the war in Ukraine. The meeting lasted five hours, but no agreement was reached yet. The U.S. is trying to help Ukraine and Russia make peace, but it's hard because Ukraine might have to give up some land. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy says Putin is stopping peace, but he likes that the U.S. is talking to Russia. The war has been going on for a long time, and people hope these talks can bring peace soon.

options: To end the war in Ukraine
questions.correct_answer: To end the war in Ukraine

questions.question: What might Ukraine have to give up in the peace deal?
Who said Putin is blocking peace?

background_read: The war between Russia and Ukraine started in 2014 and got worse in 2022. Russia invaded Ukraine, and many people have been hurt or had to leave their homes. The U.S. and other countries are trying to help stop the fighting by talking to both sides. Peace talks are meetings where leaders discuss how to end the war and make things better for everyone.
Article_Structure: WHO: Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner (U.S. envoys) and Vladimir Putin (Russian President)
WHAT: They met to negotiate ending the war in Ukraine
WHERE: At the Kremlin in Moscow, Russia
WHY: To try to make peace and stop the fighting in Ukraine

perspectives.description: The U.S. is pushing for a peace deal and meeting with Russia to help end the war.
Ukraine wants peace but is worried about giving up land, and Zelenskyy blames Putin for blocking progress.
Russia says there is no compromise yet, but some U.S. ideas might be acceptable.
